required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Flexible Laryngeal Mask Airway Versus Tracheal Intubation in Nasal Bone Fracture
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Recovery Profiles Between Flexible Laryngeal Mask Airway and Tracheal Intubation in Nasal Bone Fracture

brief_summary.textblock: In surgery under general anesthesia due to nasal bone fracture, laryngeal mask airway or tracheal intubation has been used. However, it has not been investigated that the difference of recovery profiles according to use of laryngeal mask airway or tracheal intubation in nasal bone fracture surgery. The aim of study is to evaluate the efficacy of the laryngeal mask airway regarding recovery profiles and airway complications, compared to tracheal intubation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From end of surgery to extubation
primary_outcome.description: Grade of cough during periextubation periods (0=no cough, 1=single cough, 2=more than one episode of non-sustained cough, 3=sustained and repetitive cough with head lift)

secondary_outcome.measure: Adequate tidal volume during mechanical ventilation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From insertion of airway device to extubation
From insertion of airway device to extubation
From insertion of airway device to extubation
Before anethetic induction, 1 minute after intubation, the end of surgery, 1 minute after extubation.
Before anethetic induction, 1 minute after intubation, the end of surgery, 1 minute after extubation.
Before anethetic induction, 1 minute after intubation, the end of surgery, 1 minute after extubation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with blood contamination at vocal cord and distal trachea
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between the end of surgery and extubation
secondary_outcome.description: Blood contamination was examined using fibrobronchoscope.
0=no contamination, 1=external contamination of the tube, 2=some soilage of the inner surface of the tube, 3=frank coating of the inner surface of the tube

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with airway complications after extubation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From extubation to 5 minutes after extubation
secondary_outcome.description: laryngospasm, hypoventilation (respiratory rate <8/minutes), desaturation (peripheral pulse oximetry saturation <95%)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to eye opening and time to extubation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From anesthetic discontinuation to eye opening and extubation
secondary_outcome.description: Time in seconds from anesthetic discontinuation to eye opening at verbal commend and time in seconds from anesthetic discontinuation to extubation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with postoperative airway complications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after surgery and postoperative 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Sore throat, hoarseness, dysphagia, and nausea and vomiting

arm_group.description: Flexible laryngeal mask airway is inserted for general anesthesia
Endotracheal intubation was performed for general anesthesia

intervention.description: LMA Flexible is a supraglottic airway device, which can be moved out of the surgical field without displacement of the cuff, or loss of seal for the anesthetist
Endotracheal tube is a plain tube, which is most commonly used in general anesthesia.
intervention.other_name: Portex, Smiths Medical International Ltd., South East England, United Kingdom

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with American Society of Anesthesiologists classification 1 or 2 who receive general anesthesia due to nasal bone fracture
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with high risk of aspiration, patients who anticipated difficult airway
